item1_summary:
Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 48: "We believe the portfolio continues to be well diversified and is well positioned to withstand short-term fluctuations" "We discuss our investment strategy in Item 1, Investments Segment, and results for the segment in Investments Results" "Our 5.5% ratio of debt to total capital (debt plus shareholders’ equity) decreased by 0.8 percentage points compared with the prior-year ratio"
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 1: No material changes to our estimates for incurred losses and expenses related to the pandemic related to SARS-CoV-2, also known as COVID-19 . Net income rose by $449 million in 2024, compared with 2023, including a $204 million increase in net investment gains on an after-tax basis .
 Loss experience for our insurance operations is influenced by many factors, as discussed in Critical Accounting Estimates, Property Casualty Insurance Loss and Loss Expense Reserves . Property casualty net written premiums grew 15% and earned premiums grew 12% in 2024 . Underwriting results improved in both 2024 and 2023, compared with the respective prior-year period .
 The $179 million increase in 2024 underwriting profit, compared with 2023, included a $66 million increase in losses from natural catastrophe events and $27 million less benefit from net favorable reserve development on prior accident years before catastrophe losses . A lower ratio indicates more favorable results and better underlying performance . In 2024, 2023 and 2022, favorable development on reserves for claims that occurred in prior accidents helped offset other incurred losses and loss expenses .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation's financial statements are prepared using U.S. GAAP . The company's critical accounting policies are discussed in Item 8, Note 1 of the Consolidated Financial Statements . The audit committee of the board of directors reviews the annual financial statements with management and the independent registered public accounting firm . Actual results could differ from those estimates .
 Unpaid loss and loss expenses are the estimated amounts necessary to pay for and settle all outstanding insured claims, including incurred but not reported (IBNR) claims . These reserves account for unpaid losses and losses as of a financial statement date . Gross loss and expenses were $9.937 billion at year-end 2024 compared with $8.975 billion at year-end 2023 .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 51: "We also establish IBNR reserves to provide for all unpaid loss and loss expenses not accounted for by case reserves" Case reserves of all sizes are generally reviewed on a 90-day cycle, or more frequently if new information about a loss becomes available . We monitor industry trends, cost trends, relevant court cases, legislative activity and other current events .
 PCS defines a catastrophe as an event that causes $25 million or more in insured property losses . Cincinnati Re and Cincinnati Global use of third-party catastrophe models, industry estimates, and our own proprietary adjustments are used for the estimate of ultimate losses for each catastrophe event . For asbestos and environmental claims, we calculate IBNR reserves by deriving an actuarially-based estimate of total unpaid loss and loss expenses .
 Claim counts reported and used in reserving process are measured by insurance coverages that are triggered when a loss occurs and a reserve is established . Coverages defined as unique combinations of certain attributes such as line of business and cause of loss . Unpaid loss and loss expenses are inherently uncertain as to timing and amount .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 52: "Our actuarial staff bases its IBNR reserve estimates for these losses primarily on the indications of methods and models that analyze accident year data . Accident year is the year in which an insured claim, loss or loss expense occurred . The specific models and models used for the past several years are: paid and reported loss development methods .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 53: "The determination of management’s best estimate, like the preparation of the reserve analysis that supports it, involves considerable judgment . An inter-departmental committee that includes our actuarial management team reviews the results of each quarterly reserve analysis . Committee establishes management's best estimate of IBNR reserves, which is the amount that is included in each period's financial statements .
 Our ultimate loss experience could prove better or worse than our carried reserves reflect . Even if a change reflects a fundamental shift, the full extent of the change may not become evident until years later . We typically cannot quantify the precise impact of such factors on the adequacy of reserves prospectively or retrospectively . The four most significant of the key assumptions used by our actuarial staff and approved by management are: Emergence of loss and defense and cost containment expenses, also referred to as DCCE, on an accident year basis .
 Historical earned premiums, when adjusted to reflect common levels of product pricing and loss cost inflation, can serve as a proxy for historical exposures . Calendar year inflation trends for future paid losses and paid DCCE do not vary significantly from a stable, long-term average . Certain subsets of claims, such as high frequency, high severity, or mass tort claims, have the potential to distort patterns .
 Actual paid losses, reported losses and paid DCCE are virtually certain to differ from projections . Management does not closely monitor statistically insignificant differences between actual and projected data . The actual amount required to settle all outstanding insured claims, including IBNR claims, as of a financial statement date depends on stochastic, or random, elements as well as the systematic elements captured by our models .
 The table below provides standard errors and reserve ranges by major property casualty lines of business . See Liquidity and Capital Resources, Property Casualty Loss and Loss Expense Obligations and Reserves, Range of Reasonable Reserves . The table reflects our assessment of the most likely range within which each line’s actual unpaid loss and loss expenses may fall .
 The gross reserve balance for term and whole life policy reserves was $1.456 billion, or 49.2%, of total life policy and investment contract reserves at December 31, 2024 . The reserves also include a discount rate assumption that is based on upper-medium grade fixed-income instrument yields (market value discount rates)
 Some of our universal life insurance policies contain no-lapse guarantee provisions . The reserve balance for these contracts was $1.276 billion, or 43.1%, of total life policy and investment contract reserves, at December 31, 2024 . For these policies, we establish a reserve, or other additional liability, in addition to account balance .
 The application of our invested assets impairment policy resulted in write-downs of impaired securities intended to be sold that reduced our income before income taxes by less than $1 million in 2024, $4 million in 2023 and $5 million in 2022 . Write-downs represent noncash charges to income and are reported as investment losses .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 57 . A credit loss is determined using a discounted cash flow analysis by comparing the present value of expected cash flows with the amortized cost basis . Noncredit losses are recognized in other comprehensive income as a change in unrealized gains and losses on investments . We provide information about valuations of our invested assets in Item 8, Note 2 of the Consolidated Financial Statements .
 Financial assets and liabilities recorded in the Consolidated Balance Sheets are categorized based on the inputs to the valuation techniques as described in Item 8, Note 3 . Financial assets that fall within Level 1 and Level 2 are priced according to observable data from identical or similar securities that have traded in the marketplace . Other includes the financial results of our reinsurance assumed operations, known as Cincinnati Reforms, and our London-based global specialty underwriter Cinci .
 nnati Global Underwriting Ltd. measure profit or loss for commercial lines, personal lines, excess and surplus lines and life insurance segments based upon underwriting results (profit or loss), which represent net earned premium less loss and loss expenses, or contract holders’ benefits incurred, and underwriting expenses on a pretax basis . We evaluate results for our consolidated property casualty insurance operations .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 59: "We continue working to improve underwriting profitability, such as through higher pricing and our ongoing initiatives to improve pricing precision and loss experience related to claims and loss control practices" The table below highlights property casualty results, with analysis and discussion in the sections that follow .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 20% . Agency renewal written premiums increased $819 million or 13% in 2024, compared with 2023, and continued to contribute to growth in earned premiums and net written premiums that rose in each of our property casualty insurance segments . Cincinnati Financial Corp. - 20-year-old Cincinnati Insurance Company .
 Cincinnati Re assumed risks through reinsurance treaties and cedes part of the risk and related premiums to one or more unaffiliated reinsurance companies through transactions known as retrocessions . Cincinnati Re produced $597 million of 2024 net written premiums and contributed $39 million to growth in other written premiums, compared with 2023 .
 The 2024 ratio for current accident year losses and loss expenses before catastrophes decreased by 1.8 percentage points . Price increases and other underwriting efforts have helped offset losses that have elevated significantly since 2021 due to inflation effects discussed below . We believe future property casualty underwriting results will continue to benefit from price increases and our ongoing initiatives to improve pri
 Our statutory combined ratio was 92.9% in 2024 compared with 94.6% in 2023 and 97.7% in 2022 . The industry’s ratio excluding its mortgage and financial guaranty lines of business, based on industry data reported through the first nine months of 2024 . Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 61 .
 Table shows catastrophe losses incurred for the past two calendar years, net of reinsurance, as well as the effect of loss development on prior period catastrophe reserves . We individually list declared catastrophe events for which our incurred losses reached or exceeded $25 million . Table also shows the effect on loss development and the amount of catastrophe losses we incurred .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 62: "Loss and loss expenses include both net paid losses and reserve changes for unpaid losses as well as the associated loss expenses . For all property casualty lines of business in aggregate, net loss and loss expense reserves at December 31, 2024, were $1.055 billion higher than at year-end 2023 .
 Accident years 2023 and 2022 have both developed favorably, as indicated by progression over time for the ratios in the table . Catastrophe losses added 9.6 percentage points in 2024, 9.3 points in 2023 and 10.2 points in 2022 . The 56.6% ratio for current accident year loss and loss expenses before catastrophe losses for 2024 decreased 1.8 percentage points compared with 58.4% accident year 2023 ratio measured as of December 31, 2023 .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 63. s recognized during 2024 occurred in our workers' compensation, commercial property and homeowner lines of business . Commercial casualty and workers’ compensation are considered long-tail lines with the potential for revisions inherent in estimating reserves . Favorable reserve development recognized during 2022 was primarily from our workers’ compensation and homes’s compartment lines of business.
 In 2024, total large losses incurred decreased by $98 million, or 26%, net of reinsurance . The corresponding 2024 ratio decreased 1.7 percentage points, compared with 2023 . Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 64 . The large loss data included in the table above does not include Cincinnati Re and Cincinnati Global .
 Property casualty commission expenses rose $167 million, or 12%, in 2024, with profit-sharing commissions for agencies increasing by $18 million . The 2024 ratio of commission expenses as a percentage of earned premiums decreased by 0.1 percentage points . The ratio for 2023 decreased compared with 2023, as earned premiums kept pace with other underwriting expenses .
 The commercial lines insurance segment saw a 5% increase in renewal written premiums in 2024 . Earned premiums and net written premiums rose in 2024, including a $211 million, or 5%, increase in renewal premier written premiums . The combined ratio before catastrophe losses and prior years was previously preferred and before years, revenue revenues increased to $4,486 .
 New business written premiums in 2024 increased $157 million, or 27%, compared with 2023 . Price increases and other underwriting actions have helped offset losses that have elevated significantly since 2021 due to inflation effects . Elevated inflation since 2021 has resulted in higher losses and loss expenses as costs have increased significantly to repair damaged business property or autos that we insure .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 66: Pricing precision and other initiatives to improve commercial lines underwriting profitability complement our business practices . Field marketing representatives meet with local agencies to assess each risk, determine limits of insurance and establish appropriate terms and conditions . Field loss control, machinery and equipment and claims representatives conduct on-site inspections. Field claims representatives also assist underwriters by preparing full reports on their first-hand observations of risk quality.
 Our 5% increase in 2024 agency renewal written premiums included higher average pricing . Management continues to emphasize the importance of our agencies and underwriters assessing account quality to make careful decisions on a case-by-case basis whether to write new business or renew a policy . In 2024, our standard commercial lines policies averaged an estimated pricing change at a percentage near the low end of the high-single-digit range .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 67: "The average price increase was at a percentage in the high-single-digit range" The 2024 increase of 5% for the commercial lines segment's agency renewal written premiums also included a higher level of insured exposures . Part of the insured exposure increase reflects our response to inflation effects that increase the cost of building materials .
 In 2024, commercial lines new business premiums written by our agencies increased $157 million, or 27%, compared with 2023 . New business premium volume in recent years has been significantly influenced by new agency appointments . Policyholders who experience sales or payroll volume changes due to economic factors may also have other exposures requiring insurance, such as commercial auto or commercial property .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 68: Loss and loss expenses include both net paid losses and reserve changes for unpaid losses as well as the associated loss expenses . Other written premiums primarily consist of premiums that are ceded to reinsurers and lower our net written premiums . An increase in ceded premiums reduced net written premium growth by $20 million in 2024 .
 Commercial lines accident years 2023 and 2022 for the commercial lines insurance segment have both developed favorably, as indicated by progression over time of the ratios in the table . Catastrophe losses added 6.1 percentage points in 2024 and 7.6 points in 2022 to the respective commercial lines current accident year loss and loss expense ratios .
 Most of our commercial lines net favorable reserve development on prior accident years recognized during 2024 occurred in our workers’ compensation and commercial property lines of business . Development by accident year and other trends for commercial lines loss and loss expenses are further discussed in Liquidity and Capital Resources, Property Casualty Insurance Development of Estimated Reserves by Accident Year .
 In 2024, total large losses incurred decreased by $103 million, or 35%, net of reinsurance . The 2024 decrease on a dollar basis was primarily due to a decrease of $116 million for our commercial property line of business . In 2023, total losses incurred and the corresponding ratio were higher than in 2022 . The corresponding 2024 ratio decreased 2.6 percentage points, compared with 2023 .
 Commercial lines commission expenses as a percent of earned premiums decreased slightly in 2024, compared with 2023, reflecting a decrease in the ratio for profit-sharing commissions for agencies . In 2024, other underwriting expenses increased as earned premiums rose at a slower pace than other expenses, primarily employee-related expenses . The three-year period ending in 2024 also included ongoing expense management efforts .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 71: "We intend to grow through additional agency appointments, expansion of our local field presence, enhanced expertise and product expansion that meets the needs of an even larger percentage of our agencies' total commercial portfolio" "We believe that our initiatives to improve pricing precision and lower loss costs will continue to benefit commercial lines profitability during 2025"
 Cincinnati Private Client SMnet written premiums, included in the personal lines insurance segment, rose $462 million, or 37%, to approximately $1.719 billion in 2024, representing 57.3% of the segment's 2024 net written premiums . New business written premiums rose $188 million, while new business written premiums rose $188 million .
 The 2024 combined ratio improved by 2.9 percentage points, compared with 2023 . Price increases and other underwriting efforts have helped offset losses that have elevated significantly since 2021 due to inflation effects . The improvement also included 2.5 points from a lower ratio for current accident year loss and loss expenses before catastrophe losses .
 We have increased our pricing precision and implemented numerous rate increases in recent years to improve our personal lines insurance segment results . The contribution of catastrophe losses to our personal lines statutory combined ratio was 13.9 percentage points in 2024, 15.1 percentage points in 2023 and 11.4 percentage point in 2022 . We believe agents recommend our personal insurance products to their clients who seek to balance quality and price .
 Premium rates for our personal auto line of business increased at an average percentage in the low-double-digit range during 2024 . Some individual policies experienced lower or higher rate changes based on pricing precision and current rate level indications that helped determine appropriate premium rates . The increase in agency renewal written premiums in 2024 also included a higher level of insured exposures .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 73: Loss and Loss Expenses include both net paid losses and reserve changes for unpaid losses as well as the associated loss expenses . Other written premiums primarily consist of premiums that are ceded to reinsurers and lower our net written premiums . An increase in ceded premiums reduced net written premium growth by $28 million in 2024 .
 Catastrophe losses added 15.6 percentage points in 2024, 17.3 points in 2023 and 14.0 points in 2022 . Personal lines catastrophe losses for 2024 resulted in a ratio higher than our 11.4% 10-year annual average for personal lines . The 53.9% ratio for current accident year loss and loss expenses before catastrophe losses . Other contributions included inflation effects that were offset by the favorable impact from various initiatives .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 74. 4 was favorable by $26 million, in aggregate, compared with $64 million in 2023. The 2024 net favorable reserve development included $54 million for our homeowner line of business offset by $20 million of unfavorable development for our personal auto line-of-business .
 In 2024, personal lines total large large losses incurred decreased by $1 million, or 1%, net of reinsurance . In 2023, total large losses increased, compared with 2022, primarily due to higher amounts for our homeowner line of business . We continue to monitor the volatility in addition to general inflationary trends in loss costs .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 75: "We believe we can continue to profitably grow premiums in our personal lines insurance segment through new agency appointments and an ongoing focus on diversification of product and geography . The personal lines market of the U.S. property casualty industry continued to experience challenges in 2024, including elevated inflation, increasing loss costs and pricing pressures .

 Our excess and surplus lines insurance segment includes results of The Cincinnati Specialty Underwriters Insurance Company and CSU Producer Resources Inc. Earned premiums and net written premiums continued to grow during 2024 . New business written premiums rose 11% in 2024, compared with 2023, and contributed to premium growth . The combined ratio increased by 3.4 percentage points in 2024 .
 The $70 million increase in 2024 renewal premiums largely reflected higher renewal pricing . Other written premiums in 2024 reduced net written premium growth by $5 million more than in 2023 . The majority of the total incurred losses and loss expenses shown above are for the respective current accident years, with reserve development on prior accident years shown separately .
 The 66.6% accident year 2023 loss and loss expense ratio reported as of December 31, 2023, developed favorably by 10.5 percentage points to 56.1% due to claims settling for less than previously estimated, or due to updated reserve estimates for unpaid claims . Catastrophe losses added 1.3 percentage points in 2024, 0.7 points in 2023 and 1.0 points in 2022 to the respective excess and surplus lines .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 78: "We believe the loss and loss expense reserves for our excess and surplus lines business are adequate" The amount of outstanding reserves can be seen in a table in Liquidity and Capital Resources, Property Casualty Insurance Loss and Loss Expense Obligations and Reserves .
 Property Casualty Insurance Development of Estimated Reserves by Accident Year . In 2024, total large losses increased by $6 million, net of reinsurance. The ratio for 2024 large losses as a percent of earned premiums increased by 1.0 percentage points, compared with 2023. That ratio for 2023 decreased by 0.7 percentage points .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 79: "We continue to monitor the volatility of aggregate loss experience for our portfolio of larger policies" The excess and surplus lines market is expected to see the magnitude of rate increases moderate for property-driven risks, except for catastrophe exposites . The ratio for other underwriting expenses increased in 2024 largely due to increases in employee-related expenses .
 For casualty-driven risks, premium rates in the foreseeable future are expected to be firm, primarily driven by social inflation and litigation funding impacts . New business opportunities expected to increase as standard market insurance companies continue to re-underwrite business they previously took from the excess and surplus lines market . Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 80 .
 Earned premiums increased 3% for the year 2024, as shown in the table below that includes details by major line of business . Net in-force policy face amounts rose 2% to $84.245 billion at year-end 2024 from $82.361 billion in 2023 and $80.482 billion in 2022 . Life insurance segment profit $57 million for our life insurance segment in 2024, compared with $41 million in . 2023 .
 iums increased $8 million in 2024, primarily due to a $6 million increase in term life insurance earned premiums, as shown in the table below . Total contract holders’ benefits decreased in 2024 compared with 2023, largely due to more favorable impacts from the unlocking of interest rate and other factors . Life insurance segment expenses consist principally of: life and interest-sensitive products, which accounted for 76.4% of 2024 total benefits .
 Contract holder benefits increased slightly in 2023, compared with 2022, largely due to less favorable impacts from the unlocking of interest rate and other actuarial assumptions . Mortality experience was more favorable in 2024, and net death claims were below our mortality projections . Underwriting expenses incurred, net of deferred acquisition costs, accounted for 23.6% of 2024 total benefits and expenses .
 We seek to maintain a competitive advantage with respect to benefits paid and reserve increases by consistently achieving better than average claims experience due to skilled underwriting . We exclude most of our life insurance company investment income from investments segment results . Life insurance ownership remains low compared to historical levels . We believe people prefer to speak to a professional agent before making a purchase .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 82: "We view the voluntary life space as particularly attractive" Investment income is generally our primary source of pretax and after-tax profits . Pretax investment income grew $131 million, or 15%, in 2024 . Interest income grew 22% in 2024, compared with 2023, due to net purchases of fixed-maturity securities .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation reported an investment gain in 2024 and 2023 . Pretax investment income rose 14% in 2023, including increases in interest and dividend income . Dividend income grew less than 1% in 2024, compared with 2023. Minor asset allocation adjustments in our equity portfolio, including larger than usual net sales of equity securities during the second half of 2024 .
 The table below shows total return based on assumptions that simplify cash flow timing that is commonly used in total return measures . Comparing contributions for 2024 with 2023, investment income rose $131 million, investment gains increased by $264 million and the invested assets net change in unrealized gains and losses decreased by $260 million . The base component of the return calculation, annual average invested assets, was up 13% in 2024 .
 Interest income in 2024 increased by $90 million, compared with 2022 . Dividend income rose $7 million, or 3% . The increase includes dividend rates that generally have increased, although more slowly than in prior years . The average fixed-maturity pretax yield increased by 28 basis points in addition to a larger fixed-Maturity portfolio that rose 15% on an average amortized cost basis .
 In 2024, we continued to invest available cash flow in both fixed income and equity securities in a manner that we believe balances current income needs with longer-term invested asset growth goals . As bonds in our generally laddered portfolio mature or are called over the near term, we reinvest with a balanced approach, keeping in mind our long-term strategy and pursuing attractive risk-adjusted after-tax yields .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 85 encompasses potential impact from changes in the interest rate environment and the potential for elevated inflation . The average pretax yield of 5.66% for fixed-maturity securities acquired during 2024 was higher than the 5.06% average yield-to-amortized cost of the portfolio at the end of 2024 .
 Total investment gains and losses in 2024 included $1.275 billion of net gains from recognition of fair value changes of equity securities still held that prior to 2018 would have been reported in other comprehensive income (OCI) Change in unrealized gains or losses for fixed-maturity securities are included as a component of OCI .  Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 89: "Other" includes noninvestment operations of the parent company and its commercial leasing and financial services subsidiary, CFC Investment Company . Cincinnati Re generated an underwriting profit of $86 million in 2024, $118 million in 2023 and $13 million in 2022 .
 Cincinnati Global had a $566 million income tax expense in 2024, compared with $433 million in 2023 and an income tax benefit of $207 million in 2022 . Cincinnati Global's effective tax rate for 2024 was 19.8% compared with 19.0% in . 2023 . The UK’s Pillar Two laws, generally effective as of January 1, 2024, did not have a material impact on our effective tax .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 91: "We seek to maintain prudent levels of liquidity and financial strength for the protection of our policyholders, creditors and shareholders" For tax years after 2017, for our property casualty insurance subsidiaries, approximately 75% of interest from tax-advantaged, fixed-maturity investments and approximately 40% of dividends from qualified equities are exempt from federal tax .
 The parent company had $5.203 billion in cash and marketable securities, providing strong liquidity to fund cash outflows, as needed . Cincinnati Global is required to maintain certain capital funding requirements with Lloyd’s, which the parent company may deposit on its behalf, which may fluctuate based on the profitability of Cincinnati Global .
 The primary sources of cash inflows are collection of premiums, investment income, maturity of fixed-income securities and sale proceeds from investments . Cash outflows are primarily loss and loss expenses, commissions, salaries, taxes, operating expenses and investment purchases . Excess cash flows were partially used to pay dividends to the parent company .
 The sale of investments could provide an additional source of liquidity at either the parent company or insurance subsidiary level, if required . At December 31, 2024, we had $10.836 billion of common stock securities, with $4.563 billion,  or  receiving $2,621 costs . Cash generated from investment income provides an important investment contribution to cash flow .
 The company’s senior debt is rated investment grade by four independent rating agencies . None of the rating agencies made changes to our debt ratings in 2024 . At year-end 2024, we were in compliance with all covenants under the credit agreement and believe we will remain in compliance . The company's total capital of $14.750 billion was $13.935 billion, an increase of $1.837 billion, or 15% from the prior year .
 At year-end 2024, the ratio of debt to total capital was 5.5%, compared with 6.3% in 2023 . At the discretion of the board of directors, the company can return capital directly to shareholders . The ability of our company to continue paying cash dividends is subject to factors the company deems relevant . The board's decision in January 2025 to increase the dividend demonstrated confidence in the company’s strong capital .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 94: Share repurchases can help fulfill our commitment to enhancing shareholder value . Board has authorized the repurchase of outstanding shares, giving management discretion to purchase shares at reasonable prices in light of circumstances at the time of purchase . Board believes that repurchasing is intended to offset the issuance of shares issued through equity compensation plans .
 At December 31, 2024, we had $983 millio in cash and cash equivalents . During 2025, our lead insurance subsidiary may pay a maximum of $1.245 billion in dividends to our parent company without regulatory approval . Our GAAP combined ratio averaged 94.6% over the five-year period 2020 through 2024 .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 95 . Cincinnati Financial Corp. maintains property casualty reinsurance contracts with highly rated reinsurers . We monitor the financial condition of our reinsurers because their insolvency could jeopardize a portion of our $523 million reinsurance recoverable asset at December 31, 2024 .
 The $962 million increase in total gross reserves included an $8 million decrease in case loss reserves, a $788 million increase in IBNR loss reserves and a $182 million increase in loss expense reserves . Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 96. oss Expense Reserves .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 97: "We believe our exposure to asbestos and environmental claims is limited, largely because our reinsurance retention was $500,000 or below prior to 1987 . We also were predominantly a personal lines company in the 1960s and 1970s, when asbestos and pollution exclusions were not widely used by commercial lines insurers .
 Reserving data for asbestos and environmental claims has characteristics that limit the usefulness of the methods and models used to analyze loss and loss expense reserves for other claims . We have not engaged in any mergers or acquisitions through which such a liability could have been assumed . We continue to monitor our claims for evidence of material exposure to other mass tort classes, but we have found no such credible evidence .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 98: "We made $4.381 billion of net claim payments during 2024" "We direct our associates to settle claims and pay losses as quickly as is practical" "Our estimates of gross property casualty loss and loss expense payments do not include reinsurance receivables orceded losses"
 The company established a reasonably likely range for net loss and loss expense reserves of $8.948 billion to $9.816 billion at year-end 2024 . The effective duration of our consolidated property casualty fixed-maturity portfolio was 5.2 years . We believe this difference in duration does not affect our ability to meet current obligations because cash flow from operations is sufficient to meet these obligations .
 Management’s best estimate of total loss and loss expense reserves as of year-end 2024 and 2023 was consistent with the corresponding actuarial best estimate . Actual unpaid loss and expenses could nonetheless fall outside of the indicated ranges . The Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 99 - was published in the company's 10-K .
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 100-K . Unfavorable reserve development for consolidated property casualty reserves of $236 million in 2024 illustrated potential for revisions inherent in estimating reserves . Drivers of significant reserve development typically reflect loss emergence on known claims that was more favorable or less favorable than previously anticipated for various lines of business .
 Workers’ compensation experienced favorable reserve development again during 2024, for all prior accident years in aggregate, as claim frequencies continued to decline more than we expected . We continue to monitor activity for various commercial casualty coverages so we can detect changes in trends on a timely basis . Total gross reserves increased $177 million from year-end 2023 .
 Approximately 90% of our excess and surplus lines insurance premiums are for commercial casualty coverages . Loss emergence for claims rose more than anticipated and reflected economic or other forms of inflation, similar to our commercial casualty line of business . Net reserve development was an unfavorable $8 million during 2024, following favorable development of $11 million during 2023 and $9 million during 2022 .
 At year-end 2024, ceded death benefits represented approximately 32% of our total gross policy face amounts in force . The amounts presented could materially differ from actual results . The cash flow assumptions are based on our current expectations and are reviewed annually to determine any necessary updates . The discount rate assumption is based on upper-medium grade fixed-income instrument yields (mar)
 Cincinnati Financial Corporation - 2024 10-K - Page 102 - is a risk to the company's liquidity and financial strength . We use both our own experience and industry experience adjusted for historical trends in arriving at our cash flow assumptions . For business other than Cincinnati Re and Cincinnati Global, we use the Risk Management Solutions (RMS) and Verisk models to evaluate exposures to a once-in-a-100-year event to determine appropriate reinsurance protection .
 For business other than Cincinnati Re and Cincinnati Global we use the RMS and Verisk models to estimate the probable maximum loss from a single event or multiple events occurring in a one-year period . As of the end of 2024, both models indicated that a hurricane event represents our largest amount of exposure to losses .
 The largest loss exposure to Cincinnati Re is from natural catastrophe events .
